website_summaries.verdict: Best for fitness armband newbies who have an iPhone 6 or earlier model.
pros: Company provides a lifetime warranty for replacement or full refund after product registration
Fits perfectly with any phone with a screen up to 5.2 inches
Protects phone from rain and sweat
cons: Some iPhone 7, 8, and X owners say their phones don't fit

customer_reviews.title: iPhone 5s in Defender Case Fits Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive because I have an iPhone 5s with an Otter Defender case. I didn't want to have to take the case off every day just so it would fit into this arm band. At the price, and after reading some reviews, I purchased. Glad I did! Phone in case fits snugly! The home button of the phone sits a little higher than the cutout on the front of the band, but it hasn't been an issue. Very pleased and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy B.

customer_reviews.title: ... was for my first half marathon and it worked GREAT. I have an iPhone 7 and the case ...
customer_reviews.text: My first time wearing this was for my first half marathon and it worked GREAT. I have an iPhone 7 and the case has openings for all different jacks on the side and center of the phone. The screen protector allows you to use the touchscreen and the band was great and held tight. I absolutely love it and can't wait to use it for trail runs as the weather gets better!
customer_reviews.author: Annie Rose

customer_reviews.title: Best value for running arm band
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this cant be beat. I love the key compartment and I feel like they are snug and safe while I run. The color is fun and the band is comfortable during long runs. My only drawback is that sometimes I cant navigate the touchscreen thru the plastic and I have to remove it from my arm to change songs or start my fitness app because I need to press so hard and so precisely. However, this isn't a dealbreaker and I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alex F

customer_reviews.title: BEST BANG FOR YOUR BUCK!!!
customer_reviews.text: It Fits perfect!! Was very satisfied with this company as I had left feedback that it wasn’t the right size but shipping was so much to send back it wasn’t worth it and I was just going to waste the money I spent.. but they worked with me and sent me a replacement correct size and I’m very pleased! Definitely high quality for an inexpensive price
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: A very good buy
customer_reviews.text: does exactly what I wanted - makes it possible to run or walk with a phone and earphones. easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Toussaint-Williams

customer_reviews.title: Velcro short life
customer_reviews.text: 7 months after buying this I've already replaced it. The Velcro won't hold at all anymore. I also really hated having to remove my otterbox from my phone to use this case. The holes don't match up well and accessing the volume is much harder than my former case. I had a Tune Belt before but lost it. Made the mistake of not ordering the same thing. My Tune Belt cases have previously lasted as long as my phone (iPhone 4), which is why I had initially ordered it for my new phone. Glad to be switching back after this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Osburn

customer_reviews.title: Strap is too short, too tight
customer_reviews.text: I can barely get this around my upper forearm, let alone my bicep, which is where I want to wear it. I do not have exceptionally large arms either. Adding the phone to the pocket makes putting the armband on nearly impossible. The touchscreen seems to work OK, though in the corners it can be difficult to make contact with the phone's screen. After a forty-minute walk, my arm and the armband were both wet with sweat, so the moisture wicking is essentially nonexistent. The only positive I have is that the velcro does hold tightly.
customer_reviews.author: Danton M.

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic service and the product is just what I needed/was looking for. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Moore

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to run with and quick dry
customer_reviews.text: This is the first product I bought for my phone so I can bring it running and so far I have no complaints. It's comfortable to run with, easy to dry and the waterproof screen works pretty well too.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Walton

customer_reviews.title: Awful very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was very hopeful after seeing good reviews. But..... this product is awful I do not recommend it at all. First I tried it and it was so itchy the entire time, it kept falling, it kept locking my phone and was so difficult to see the screen. I thought maybe I wasn’t used to it so give it a couple tries but I really don’t like it, it also gave me a rash on my arm. I do not recommend this arm band at all. If I could give it zero stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Great for Running
customer_reviews.text: The armband sits comfortably and securely around and on my arm over a range of speeds and movements.
customer_reviews.author: L.E.

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR ATHLETIC WOMEN
customer_reviews.text: If you are female and in good shape, this will be GIGANTIC on you! This is the second armband I have had to return for this reason, and I’m beginning to think Amazon simply does not carry armbands for active females. I lift frequently and have extremely muscular arms, but this armband is still WAY too big. PLEASE start making smaller straps!!!
customer_reviews.author: BBW

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this one
customer_reviews.text: I hated this. It’s a bear trying to fit my iPhone in there. It wasn’t meant for you to have a case on your phone. The touch screen is crap. You can’t volume up or down without pulling it out. Your going to rip it pulling your phone out. It flops around during runs. It doesn’t fit well.
customer_reviews.author: F. N. Price

customer_reviews.title: Great band for running
customer_reviews.text: This band has been great. I have only had it for a week now, but I run 2-3 miles daily and it has been a great addition. It has remained snug and secure while running without bouncing or becoming loose. It definitely is moisture wicking as I don’t even feel sweat on the inner side post runs. The touch screen has not been hindered by the plastic screen protector on the band and I like the little key slot too. I am very happy with this band.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great armband! Lasted 3 years!
customer_reviews.text: This armband is really durable and easy to clean. I bought it in 2016 and I have used it for my daily runs and gym workouts. It holds pretty well and has definitely lasted more than I expected. - It's easy to clean: just throw it in the washer! - I have an iPhone 7 and it fits in the armband very well. Doesn't bounce when I move. - I'd say the only drawback is that the clear plastic sticks to the phone screen and makes it hard to get my phone out after working out. - After 3 years of usage, the stitches of the strap are starting to come apart which is totally acceptable after all this time.
customer_reviews.author: Jan S. Liev

customer_reviews.title: Secure case
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing for holding your phone securely on your arm and out of your way. You do not need help putting the band on. You can do it all by yourself. I have an iPhone 11 and it fits securely in the case, but the button holes do not line up perfect. The reason it lost a star is because the touch screen plastic is not as sensitive as It needs to be. It takes a definitive pressure in order to accomplish anything on your phone. Make sure to have your phone set up the way you want before putting in the case or you may have to take your phone back out.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Hands-free...worry-free.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, the armband looks huge. Don’t let that fool you. The design is purposeful. The material used safely and securely holds my XR. There are three slits at the bottom that I used for attaching my headphones. Never once during my run was I worried about my phone coming out. It was also very reassuring to have the armband not slide down my arm while running. That was my only concern to be honest. The touch screen ability was “icing on the cake”. I love being able to listen to music and track distance, rate, etc. Overall, I am thoroughly pleased with this purchase. If I had to purchase this item again, I most certainly would.
customer_reviews.author: rksezate

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Running Armband!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several armbands, and the Tribe Fitness band is hands down my favorite. My phone slides in and out of the pouch easily, there are two options for the arm size, and the material is comfortable on my skin. My only complaint is that the plastic cover ripped after about a year of use. I admittedly use this band 4-6 times a week, I sweat A LOT, and it's even been with me through some pretty heavy rain storms, so I guess that's to be expected. As I mentioned before, this is still my favorite armband, and it was worth it to me to invest in a second.
customer_reviews.author: ebeth ann

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: The armband feels comfortable and i don’t even notice its there once i get the tightness right. It’s a little tight for my iPhone X with a larger-ish otter box case, but I can get it in and out without too much difficulty and tightness probably reduces bouncy feelings. The key holder built into the armband is perfect. I don’t have to hide my key in my headphones case outside my property anymore. The screen cover does make using the phone difficult, but I just get my music and exercises ready before I put it in, so I only need to hit the start button.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Cheap-quality, flimsy, and poor fit for non-Plus iPhones
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it will technically fit, but this is clearly designed for the "Plus" version of the phones. The non-Plus versions will slide around in there, and the home button won't match up unless you manually move the phone around to make it each time. It's basically just a piece of stamped out neoprene with holes and clear plastic for the screen. If I had kept the packaging, I'd be returning this. Instead it'll probably go in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Tore on first use
customer_reviews.text: Was hopeful for this as my wife has a similar one. Made sure this case said it was for my iPhone XR, but on first use it was obviously tight, and by the time I got it all the way in, it tore on the top part. I do have a case on it, but it’s a slim one, and my phone fits on my wife’s armband case, so I’ll order another model that my wife has. Maybe it was a fluke but buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Stays put, Forget its there!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could track my distance and listen to music. It is very comfortable...I never even pay it attention while biking, running, or working out. It stays in place very well! The key holder works great for chapstick. My S9 fits well with room to spare. I don't have to take off the case (my case is just the back cover kind...it's not bulky). The phone is easy to get in and out in a pinch. The only negative is that the touch screen aspect isn't great, but I generally don't need to touch my phone while wearing this. If it's that important, I can easily take it out.
customer_reviews.author: QueenB

customer_reviews.title: Nice case overall, just be careful if you have larger biceps
customer_reviews.text: I like this case overall. I’m 6’1” ish and about 215lbs. I’m not that muscular and this strap is at about its’ largest size. If I had a little more bicep muscle, I wouldn’t be able to wear this case. To my knowledge, they don’t make a small and large size, so that’s something they should think about.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Durable Supportive Armband
customer_reviews.text: Upgrading to an iPhone plus meant buying a new armband to take running. This armband held up to the larger phone and didn't slip or need readjusting while I ran. The large size fits the iPhone 8+ with the case. The case I have isn't very thick; If you have an Otterbox or a thicker case, the armband won't fit around both the phone and case. The touchscreen worked well through the plastic cover. The only issue I had was hitting the home button. I had to hit it a few times before the phone would wake up. Once it was awake, I had no issues with the touch screen. Overall, I would recommend this armband for larger phones.
customer_reviews.author: Khall

customer_reviews.title: Choose Another
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this two stars because the one star ("I hate it") seems too harsh. This armband doesn't cost much, and you get what you pay for. The fact that it claims to be "water resistant" is laughable--the material soaks up the sweat from your skin and the cover is just a piece of thin plastic with a hole in it. My phone (iphone SE) doesn't feel remotely secure within the pocket--the closing method is just a flap of material you pull over another flap of material. I would say upgrade to a better model. I find this to be almost totally useless--I should have spent more money the first time around for a better phone armband.
customer_reviews.author: LindsayRoseEliz

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 love it
customer_reviews.text: I got as a gift for my dad who is new to smartphones. He wanted a way to listen to music while walking around. This is absolutely perfect. iPhone SE (new one) with otterbox defender case fits in just fine. The iPhone SE is the same size as the iPhone 8 for reference. Product is stretchy but strong and won’t let your phone fall out. I Put my iPhone 8 with an otterbox commuter case on it in this arm band for an 8 mile run with no issues. The band doesn’t slip and it’s pretty good at moisture wicking.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I hate writing bad reviews but this thing just did not work. I was so disappointed. The plastic covering was not stretched tight enough for me to be able to use the touchscreen on my phone (iPhone X). Might work with the larger phone????
customer_reviews.author: P. A. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with iPhone 7 as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I am actually returning it. I cannot use it bc I have an iPhone 7, which it’s supposed to be compatible with, but there’s no opening for the headphones to plug into the phone, there are 2 holes on the bottom for the speakers,& even a spot to hold your headphone wires, but no Opening to plug them in. Also they have to be returned through UPS, & working nightshift, they close by 6:30, so it’s taking me a couple of days to get them there to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Zannetti

customer_reviews.title: Should have ordered long ago
customer_reviews.text: It's been so worth it. The touch screen works beautifully and it's easy to get the phone in and out. It's not only perfect for working out but for working at home. I use bluetooth when working around the house or out in the yard but never have had a place to put my phone so if listening to music, a podcast or on a phone call it wasn't unusual to lay the phone down without even realizing it, and I've forgotten where it is more times than I care to admit. That's no longer a problem. If you're thinking about it just do it, you'll wonder what took you so long.
customer_reviews.author: plazaliz

customer_reviews.title: Great armband
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Tribe armband. The elasticity and comfort on your arm is perfect. The ease of getting your phone in and out is also great (I don't really attempt to use the plastic touch screen feature). One downside - velcro gets worn out and starts to scratch/cut your arm when used for a long time. Luckily price is good so replacing is easy. Also, just found out about their lifetime warranty so maybe next time it wears down, I don't need to spend more money!
customer_reviews.author: Kimi L.

customer_reviews.title: Large is Too large for iPhone 11
customer_reviews.text: The Size: Due to the generic one-size-fits all models, the Large is too large for the iPhone 11 (base model); it has about 3/4" space left in the case, which just adds to an already large case. Touch screen works fine, but using an armband for an iPhone 11 creates. The armband is built well and has good feature for keys and headphones wires, but overall, I would recommend getting a specific case for your phone to workout with. Wearing this is like wearing a half-sleeve. It gets the job done, it's comfortable, but I'll check into other ones later
customer_reviews.author: CCorns

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Understand I've just used it for the first time this morning. It wasn't too pinchy the elastic pinched a bit. It would be nice to be able to rotate it or pop it off if needed but it worked really well. I'll get the hang of securing the cord for my head phones so I won't have the cord dangly too much. I'm excited to have it and get my phone out of my pocket. It was snug but not too tight...so blood flow was good. It almost doesn't fit but I've found out they have an extender for larger arms.
customer_reviews.author: South40

customer_reviews.title: One thing wrong, but a wonderful buy
customer_reviews.text: I would give it a perfect review, the side buttons don't work well. That means you have to have your screen open before placing the phone in the sleeve. Also, the volume will be controlled by your Bluetooth headset. Other than that, for the price and the quickness of delivery you CONNOT beat the price. It's a wonderful buy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wiiliams

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone Holder!
customer_reviews.text: I love this holder. It keeps my phone out in the open so that my bluetooth earbuds do not have any more connection issues. It also has 6 cut outs for great headphone jack access if you need to use wired headphones. It slides in nice and easy, and is super easy to adjust and make comfortable on your arm (or even leg!). I especially love the reflective edging because I do walk during the late evening and by the time I get home, it is well after dark.
customer_reviews.author: Gnytmare

customer_reviews.title: Great for running, stayed secure on my arm & the headphone wire remained in place
customer_reviews.text: The tribe case certainly met the standards the company states & supported by many positive reviews I read before purchasing. I’m a runner & had none of the issues I’ve had with other brands. The armband is comfortable, did a great job with its moisture wicking capabilities in today’s 93 degrees I ran in and I had zero issues navigating my screen through the case, a big issue with other brands I’ve had. I have an I-phone 8 and it fits very well, no bouncing around.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my Tribe Armband case. I was worried I would have to take off the case I currently have on my iPhone for it to fit properly, but there was no need. Its comfortable and convenient when working out or just walking/running. I was looking for something to keep my phone near me when working out to be available for calls/texts, and just to be close for bluetooth purposes, without having to stuff my phone in my bra or pockets and this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Melendez-Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Good armband for bulky phones
customer_reviews.text: Pros: This armband fits my phone with its protective case, so I don't have to take the case on and off - huge convenience. I can easily use my phone's touch screen. My house key is secure in the key compartment, and won't fall out. Cons: After several months of wear, the nylon has completely separated from the neoprene on the top flap (see picture). It's starting to peel away on a second area. It's awkward to adjust the band one-handed, so I've ended up leaving it at the correct size and pulling it on and off my arm. My sweat gets wicked inside the armband where my phone sits, resulting in a very sweaty phone.
customer_reviews.author: C Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Look For Something Else
customer_reviews.text: I suppose for someone who has super toned arms, this case would maybe stay in place. But just trying it on, I don't feel confident in it. I don't think it gives my arm enough range of movement either. The fabric is rather uncomfortable - scratchy and unbreathable. The plastic screen makes phone access possible, but difficult. I only see this problem growing worse with any amount of sweat on my fingers. I'm not impressed. I won't be using it. And I won't be returning either, because the shipping cost would outweigh the annoyance and hassle. Verdict: I think I'll stick with my FlipBelt for now.
customer_reviews.author: aetinson

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Iphone 11
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect and I am still able to use headphones. My arms are chubby so it doesn't fit around my upper arm comfortably that isn't the products fault though. However I wear it on my forearm or use it to attach my phone to my workout bike. The touch screen still works when in use you just have to be patient.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: For serious lifters and highly active people.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best smart phone holder for lifting I've ever used. I've broken several other brands of this item simply by the weight lifting I do. If you're a power lifter (like I am) or a long distance runner (which I am not) this is the best arm mounted smart phone holder/protector you can buy. Velcro holds solid, material will not rip. As a life long athlete and power lifter, I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: YAY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking high and low for an armband, and this purchase is my second attempt. I haven't had a chance to put it to the running test yet, but I can already tell that it looks great and is exactly what I was looking for. It's minimalist, beautiful color, sturdy/durable fabric, and adjustable. As an added bonus, the large size fits my iPhone 11 Pro Max while wearing its Otterbox Symmetry case! Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Renée

customer_reviews.title: Secure, fits great, and keeps your home button free for use!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent sport armband--the first I've ever purchased for my phone, so I was nervous about finding the right one to keep it secure. I keep my phone in a minimal-coverage case, and I do have to remove the case before putting my phone in the armband--so note that before you purchase this product. However, the sizing is perfect and the velcro closure is secure. While I use wireless earbuds, it's SO nice that there is a little flap that will keep your earbud wire contained. There's also a key pocket, but I haven't used that, either. Great color options, and I assume that this is machine washable. Would highly recommend, and would definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: mlsoriano07

customer_reviews.title: Does what it’s supposed to do!!!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed using this on my long run! It feels tight and secure on my arm while still very comfortable! It does what it’s supposed to do! Would totally recommend it. My only advise is to make sure you look at the selection you’re buying bc there are 3 options you can choose from, I have an iPhone X and got the small accidentally but it still fits!!! Only it has the home button cut out on the plastic screen and that was a little bit annoying to deal with when trying to toggle through apps while wearing the band, so just pay attention to which one you buy!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sek

customer_reviews.title: My review
customer_reviews.text: I like the design, however it doesn't fit my Apple iphone very well. I also have a Samsung and althiught the fitting is better, the placement doesn't allow the screen to stay on. As soon as it is encased, the screen closes, and when you open it, it immediately closes again. So I cannot use it for my Samsung. I like the design but feel like it wasn't fully tested for these mobile devices. iPhone 8plus and Galaxy S10 plus. The band is constructed well and fitment is great on your arm. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Auggie

customer_reviews.title: Terrible for Women
customer_reviews.text: This is terrible!! Am I the only one when I put on to run it slips all the way down my arm to my wrist, so I end up carrying it. Only good for a man or women with bigger arms. Terrible - tossed it in the trash! Bought another one for $5.00 works great.
customer_reviews.author: sky

customer_reviews.title: Fits my phone
customer_reviews.text: This fits my phone perfectly. I wish the band was a little bigger. I wear it on my upper arm and they are not really big arms - normal size I would say. Once on though, it does stay in place. Works okay for using the screen while wearing it. I normally set my music to on and don't answer texts or emails when I'm working out. If I get a call, it is easy to answer with the screen. Love the colors too
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Quality is questionable
customer_reviews.text: The velco chaffs my arm. I’m 5’9” 155lbs skinnyish arms. The pocket that holds the phone is getting loose and the fabric is separating from the foam. This is is my 1st phone arm band and I walk 3 times a week and do not sweat much if at all. Ive been using the arm band for a month. I wish it was better quality but don’t have much to compare it to. Perhaps this is the standard but I hope not.
customer_reviews.author: Smoore

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Functional!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when I ordered this product. I've had other armbands, belt gizmos etc...and they all were awful. This one is actually comfortable, stays in place, and I can still use the touch screen on my phone through the covering. I haven't had the opportunity to test how waterproof it is because I'm a pansy and won't run in the pouring rain but we did have showers over Memorial weekend and my phone was just peachy! Really happy with this item!
customer_reviews.author: glam1835

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Just took it out for my first run. Loved it! My iPhone XR has an Otterbox Defender and it fits inside. It’s a tight squeeze and the touch screen would probably work better if the phone was not in the case because it leaves a gap between the screen and the edge of the otterbox case. But you can make do with it. I love the key pocket and space to insert headphones. Great value. And the arm band does not slide around when running and is not itchy, very comfortable. Also my phone did not get hot or sweaty while in it.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Hard to access phone while using arm band
customer_reviews.text: The straps hold the phone pretty snug and stays in place while running. However, it’s so hard to remove it if you need to answer a call during a workout. Doesn’t allow easy phone touch screen access if you want to adjust the side volume, etc. you have to stop and remove it completely. Velcro on the corners is a bit itchy and sharp too when it rubs on the skin while running..
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Good if you’re used to running with an armband
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is fine- I’m just not used to running with a massive phone on my arm! It’s definitely going to take some getting used to. That’s nothing against the product though since I have a large phone (iPhone 11) and apparently not as big of arms as I thought I had ;-) the band does seem to slip while I’m running even though I’ve got the Velcro as tight as it will go. And there is plenty of arm fat so I wouldn’t have assumed that would be an issue for me LOL
customer_reviews.author: Chandrika

customer_reviews.title: Barely Fit.
customer_reviews.text: Even without the case, this barely closed over my S8+. With a little practice I got it in there frequently, but if you're not planning to wear it for hours at a time, I'd recommend something easier to get your phone into and out of. Not exactly a design flaw, and if anything it's my fault for not thinking of it when I was buying it (which is why it gets 3 stars instead of 1), but cramming my phone into this thing for an hour and then wrestling it back out made workouts unnecessary anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Kal Teague

customer_reviews.title: Solid buy
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding cell phone holder for working out. It stays in place, doesn’t cut into the skin, and I barely notice it when walking (3-5 miles at a time), rowing, or bike riding. At first I was worried about the key pocket and whether or not my key would stay, but it works just fine. That key doesn’t move at all. In fact, it can be a little tough to get out. There’s no impact to the touchscreen, and I can use my phone with touchscreen-appropriate gloves while behind the plastic. It’s not unreasonably sweaty nor is my skin irritated when I finish my workout. Superb value at the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and the maker will spam you for reviews
customer_reviews.text: For $10, the product is okay. Very cheap construction. The sleeve opening is already stressed about to tear after only a half dozen uses. Because it's intended to accommodate various models of the same general size, there are no model specific openings (as expected). But the fit is sloppy enough on an iPhone 6 that squeezing the screen lock is hit or miss. The screen protector fogs up quickly - I don't know whether this accumulated condensation is enough to damage the phone over the long haul, but I'm not risking it so have thrown it away and replaced it with the Frieq. I considered this 3-star until the spam from "Derek from Tribe Inc" started begging for reviews.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lucia

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, nice material
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, nice material. Stays put on your arm. I personally prefer to have it on my forearm by my elbow then you can still see your screen. I have wireless headphones though so keep in mind that may not work when using corded headphones. This would be 5 stars if the elastic was for normal sized arms...works great other then that. I wish there wasn't the hole for the center button though because I bought this due to it being waterproof but it's not very waterproof if there's a hole to direct water directly into the phone. I get that it's because of finger print scanners but mine isn't even in that spot. Overall really nice quaity
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Boell

customer_reviews.title: This was what I was looking for jogging
customer_reviews.text: This product worked the way that I wanted it to. The iPhone 11 with a case easily slipped into place with touchscreen functions working properly through the plastic screen. There is even a section where you can put your wires through if you have wired earbuds or headphones which is convenient. The velcro straps didn't cause issues and helped secure my phone in place while jogging through the neighborhood. I would recommend this product for all those who are exercising and keeping active during these odd times we are experiencing. Also I suggest registering this product for the lifetime warranty just in case something goes iffy.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie P Craw

customer_reviews.title: Fits great on my arm
customer_reviews.text: Fits great, it is easy to interact with the screen and allows me to record my walks without having to hold the phone in my hand. It is hard to access the side buttons, but since I do not turn my screen off while I exercise, that is not a problem for me. If you want yous to turn off, be sure to set the time out options in your phone's settings.
customer_reviews.author: Terri in Jax

customer_reviews.title: It does fit a Galaxy S8+
customer_reviews.text: This seems well made. It does fit a Galaxy S8+. Just. It's a bit of a stretch and getting my earphone jack in is a bit fiddly. The touch screen does work. Not well but it does work. Materials seem good quality though and it's secure.. Can't use the phone buttons when the phone is in the case. It does what it's supposed to do. I can run, walk, lift weights and it stays on my arm.
customer_reviews.author: Spiny Norman

customer_reviews.title: Nice arm band!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to hold my Google Pixel phone while running. It does a great job. It is as comfortable as an armband can be...you feel it, but it isn't obtrusive. The medium fits my Pixel 4 with OtterBox case. The touch screen still works, but requires a little extra pressure. So far I'm very happy with it and would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Mac

customer_reviews.title: Confident in the purchase
customer_reviews.text: After using the band for a couple months, I can safely say I am really happy with my purchase, The size was perfect for my S10, the band is secure enough to never slip off my arm, but isn't so restrictive to make my arm feel uncomfortable during my jogging sessions. The touchscreen is a bit of a hit or miss, but I never really aim to use my phone during my runs, so I'm more happy the screen does a good job of keeping the rain off my phone during those more grueling days. Thank you TRIBE.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great armband for those with smaller arms
customer_reviews.text: **UPDATE: After a few months the screen covering cracked (possibly from me running through the cold and winter). But I contacted the manufacturer and they replaced it. I have a small arm and have had difficulty in the past finding an arm band that is small enough for me and will stay put. The Tribe armband is small enough and secure to keep my phone on my arm where I want it. I went running with it and it didn't move from where I had it!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda D

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for working out!
customer_reviews.text: I love how comfortable this arm band is and how responsive the screen is on it. It makes it easy to use the touch screen of my phone with minimal delay or feedback. You don’t have to press very hard on it to use the screen protector. It has a comfortable fit and I like the additional little slots it has to hold your earbuds or your keys.
customer_reviews.author: Niki Abram

customer_reviews.title: Its okay, does not fit phones that are in somewhat bulky cases.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this for when I run as my phone in my pocket weighs me down and its annoying to hold at times. This item WAS what I was looking for until I realized my phone does not fit best while in its otterbox... and I am NOT about to take my otterbox off everytime I run. Also, I love listening to music while running and I found that while using this, it did not make it all that possible to change songs by touching the screen for its very thick, unresponsive plastic over the phone screen. I would not buy again, I am just going to give it someone else who might be able to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Google Pixel with Spigen case perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this armband with my Google Pixel phone and Spigen Rugged Armor case. The phone fits perfectly - no need to remove the case - and the headphone jack lines up with the slot in the armband. Works great for listening to podcasts while I run. To accommodate arms of different sizes, the armband has two slots so you can adjust the strap (you can see them in the photo). Deducting one star because it's possible to have an arm that's just a little small when the strap is in the "large" position, and a little too big when the strap is in the "small" position.
customer_reviews.author: Jill H.

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my OnePlus 7 pro. I was tired of having to carry my phone during my walks/runs. I like the fact that this phone can fit in this armband with a case on it. The case I'm currently using is the official OnePlus mesh case, so it's a pretty slim case and it is still able to fit in the armband without any issues. I've used this armband on a 4 mile run and there was some moisture that accumulated, but it wasn't a big deal. The product itself does its job and seems to be made of decent quality. I'd recommend this product to anyone else looking for an armband. The price isn't too bad either.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised with this product, for the price, I thought for sure it would be cheap and I didn't expect much. To my surprise, when this arrived, I strapped in my iPhone 6s and I vigorously shifted my arms, much faster than I would achieve while exercising and the phone didn't budge and my arm remained comfortable. I would most certainly purchase again, though with a lifetime warranty, I won't be needing to any time soon!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for my iphone SE as expected it was to large for it. However, it is of great quality and hold very well during intense jogs. The touch screen is a bit awkward through my phone's screen protector plus the plastic on the sleeve. Not sure how to really avoid it without taking out the phone case. Overall. goof product.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had to go through a few different phone carriers for my workouts (running and weights). So far, I've tried the fanny pack, zipper in athletic clothing, and these arm bands. I think because I have an iPhone 8 plus, it's difficult to carry this phone during workouts. I enjoyed this at first, but now it seems like the arm band is loosening up - not sure if it's because my phone is heavy or what. I also have trouble seeing how to change song titles because of the glare.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa Isabel

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after 3rd use...
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about buying this product and it worked great the first two times I used it. During my THIRD run using it the seams began to bust. I wear it on my bicep, average size bicep and after the first seam went, they all started going. I limped this product thru a few more workouts and now it's shredded. It didn't survive 10 workouts. I recommend not purchasing this.
customer_reviews.author: Razor

customer_reviews.title: Works great for running!
customer_reviews.text: I used to be that girl that just held her phone on a run... until I dropped it. Face down. And the screen SHATTERED. I’ve been using this ever since. The only down side to this is that the Velcro is pretty strong, so I had a hard time adjusting it, but that also means it’s not going anywhere once you have it on. I wore it for 2 hours on a 20k this weekend and it didn’t move one bit.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Dopheide

customer_reviews.title: won’t pop off while running- might come apart tho
customer_reviews.text: * update changed from 4 stars to 3- the plastic is coming apart- haven't had it that long, sadly. I do like it and am purchasing another. I was keeping the case on my phone as the fit was a little loose. I will now not do that in hopes the plastic seal lasts longer, knowing it will not allow for perfect match up up my finger print to hole. ive had so many of these. guest things first- the velcro IS velcro- it works. feels sturdy. yes!! there’s no access to power or volume buttons, but i don’t need those. best one i’ve found so far
customer_reviews.author: missniche

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my TRIBE Water Resistant Cell Phone Armband with an S7 for about a week now when I jog and so far so good. The most important thing for me is that holds my phone securely on my arm. So far I have been using it on my forearm for easy access to my phone. The only minor quibble I have is that sometimes it takes two tries to get my phone's touchscreen to respond but I can live with that. The real test will come when I stop long sleeves as it gets warmer. I tend to sweat a lot and it is pretty corrosive :). WIll the armband stands up to it.
customer_reviews.author: Fabricio Zelaya

customer_reviews.title: May not fit your otterbox
customer_reviews.text: Touch screen is workable. I haven't tried other arm bands so I don't have much to compare it to. I have a LG G6 with an otterbox defender case and I have to take the silicone sleeve off for the phone to fit. Not a huge inconvenience but not ideal either. Moisture wicking seems fine for the light workouts I do, not sure how it would hold up for a really heavy impact activity though. Stays in place fine for me while jogging. I'm not wowed by it but it does what I need it to do and is a decent value considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: This is an alright band to have for your phone. You can't fit you phone in it with any sort of case on it. And when it's in the band by itself, it's too loose and falls to the bottom, not matching up with the holes it has in the front. I don't see how it would be water proof when it's just a pocket you slide your phone into. There isn't a zipper or anything like that to keep water out. I hardly use it and it works for running, but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Emmy

customer_reviews.title: It works well but it's too small for my small arms
customer_reviews.text: I do not have big biceps by any stretch of the imagination, however, this barely fits around my bicep to the point that it's so tight that it's uncomfortable. I have to wear it around my forearm and then it just feels in the way. I like the way my phone fits into the sleeve of it. I like the look of it. The touch screen could be more responsive but it does work most of the time. But seriously, the fact that it doesn't fit around my arm is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Holman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this armband at 8pm last night and it was at my front door today at noon. CRAZY!! It’s even better than expected. It is made with great quality and construction. It feels and looks so much more expensive than what I paid. I got the large size for my iPhone 8 Plus and it fits perfectly. I am able to type easily through the screen. I was afraid it might not fit because my arms/biceps are big but it fits perfectly when I strap it thru the farther slot. I’m already telling friends to go order one of these.
customer_reviews.author: L Dumas

customer_reviews.title: Works for small arms
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a waterproof armband to use while running. I have skinny arms, and didn't think this would stay up, but it works well, and so far hasn't stretched out. The touch screen aspect doesn't really work, and I discovered after a week of use there is a hole in the front cover that prevents his from being truly waterproof, but it works well for running on dry days. The backing material is comfortable, but does absorb sweat - if you sweat alot the band will be soaked through and will make the back of your phone wet. For the price, I'm happy with this, but there are definitely improvements that could be made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the one you want
customer_reviews.text: This thing works very well. Exactly what is listed. Comfortable, water resistant, and secure. Looking at the other reviews of this armband where it rips and tears... I don't know what people are doing to theirs. Unless you're throwing this armband in a dryer with a bunch of steak knives, you'll be fine. And when it comes to moisture, as long as you aren't outside in a full on thunderstorm, your phone will be fine. People that gave this a bad rating are grading this thing on hurricane conditions. Also, I have pretty big arms and was concerned the larger fit slot on here wasn't going to fit comfortably. It does. So no worries if you have larger arms.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work with Moto G4 PLUS
customer_reviews.text: Would give a zero if I could. This product has a strap at the top covering the headphone jack, the screen area is too small, and The strap covers up the power button making it impossible to use the phone while strapped to the arm. I'd like my money back. But I tried to make good out of a s***ty situation by cutting the top to allow for my headphones to plug in. These generic designs are terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several of these over the years. I run a lot, so I get about 1 year of good use out of it before it needs replaced. I keep buying them because they're decent quality for the price, comfortable, and just plain work. I do quite a bit of trail running, and they hold up well to the uneven terrain and more aggressive running. It stays in place on my arm and doesn't cause any irritation, even on longer runs. I periodically throw it in the laundry, and just make sure to let it air dry as opposed to running it through the dryer, to keep it clean. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mtbmaniak

customer_reviews.title: Water Resistant Cell Phone Armband ?
customer_reviews.text: It works fine, fits fine on arm, but I have an I-phone 6 and you have to take the cover off of the phone to put it in this. It is a really tight fit. The hole on the bottom doesn't really match up with the whole/button on the phone. The phone kind of sticks out on top - I am unable to get the phone all the way in this contraption . But for walking around with the phone on your arm so that you can hear it with or without ear buds, it works okay But of course it wouldn't be water resistant now would it be ??
customer_reviews.author: msworty

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: Received armband today, it look and feel strong and well made. My only concern is, on the plastic that covers the face of the phone, there is a permanent crease that i at first thought was a hole, but turned out to be a just a small defect on the plastic than i can live with. Have not used it yet. But from the appearance i see now, i am happy with the choice I made with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: PRIME MEMBER

customer_reviews.title: Just fine
customer_reviews.text: Seem to be "fine". I've never needed / wanted / used an armband for my phone before, so have nothing to compare. The fit for my iPhone SE is a little loose, and the screen isn't as responsive as I would like... but it does work. Unlike other reviews, I have not had an issue with sweat soaking through. I suspect that depends on how hard and long the wearer is perspiring. Reasonably comfortable - although it does slip some when I'm using a weight machine. Need to be careful of placement on your arm to avoid interference and slipping.
customer_reviews.author: Frank W.

customer_reviews.title: Stays stiff for a while, difficult to change music during a workout
customer_reviews.text: Not as flexible as I was hoping. Takes a little bit of breaking in for it to get less stiff, once that has happened it’s not bad. The plastic screen and fabric edges overlap the phone screen in such a way that it is not easy to access my music during my workout. Moderately difficult to take the phone out of the case and put it back in during a workout.
customer_reviews.author: Tanis Coralee Leonhardi

customer_reviews.title: Great arm band!
customer_reviews.text: This armband fits my iPhone 11 with its case on. I have tiny arms and it fits my arms. It is perfect for exercising or walking so your hands are free and your phone still available. I love this case and the price is right also. Their website is easy to use to register it. Top notch company
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: Great to run with
customer_reviews.text: The issues I had with this: 1) the earphone wire keeps flopping when i run, so I just tuck part of it into the armband or wrap it behind the armband so it doesn't flop. 2) if you want to use the camera (sometimes I like to take some pictures along my run), you have to take the armband completely off, tuck it out of the top part so the arm band isn't covering up the camera lens. That part is the biggest hassle. Other than that, it works fine to run with.
customer_reviews.author: Master P.

customer_reviews.title: Nice pouch, band size should be twice as long
customer_reviews.text: I love this but the band is way too short. I’m not a large person and I’m a runner - skinny arms- and this barely fits around my bare skin, and when it’s really warm or I run a lot of miles the Velcro chafes. In other bands I’ve normally worn a small. I got this because I got a larger cell phone, and now need another band for winter - this band will not fit over bulky clothes or layers, but the sizing of the band is so wonky, I will likely buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: S. Devine

customer_reviews.title: This is the ARMBAND!
customer_reviews.text: I like to buy quality products, not always looking the price. But, when a company stands behind their products it's something that I value. The ARMBAND is comfortable, strong stitching, gentle to the skin and quality materials. backed by the best guarantee!!! What are you waiting? Let's hit the GYM,HIKING,RUNNING and more...
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Quality

customer_reviews.title: iPhone Carry Along
customer_reviews.text: I use my Tribe to secure my iPhone while cutting grass on the riding mower. Volume is up just enough to hear and it helps to cancel the motor noise. The armband works well, but I am still learning how to secure it with having the velcro chafe my inner arm. Overall it does work. My only beef with the touch screen is that the clear plastic isn't large enough for me to swipe up and change screens.
customer_reviews.author: Paintslinger

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me at all
customer_reviews.text: The touch screen sensitivity wasn't good and the iPhone fit was also too tight. I wish I had taken the time to return it but I waited too long before I actually tested it out. I just hold the phone in my palm now as I run, which is much better than using this gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfberry

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional quality running/workout armband for phone
customer_reviews.text: Fits arm perfectly. Phone stays inside, and never slides. The armband is water proof, and stays on arm through running and workout. Very comfortable, as long as it isn’t too tight. (It’s adjustable) the touch screen is decent, and there is even a hole in the bottom and top of it for earbuds/headphones connecting to phone. Would recommend great quality. Great gift idea for fitness. Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great product Annoying Company
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the Prime day small business deal. It arrived with no issues. The armband holds my iPhone 11 Pro Max perfectly. The front of the pouch bubbles out a little so I have to press down harder than I would expect to use the touch screen, but it does work perfectly. The only problem I have is with the company. They bugged the **** out of me trying to get me to write a review. I would never buy from them again just for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Feely

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I'd hoped for .
customer_reviews.text: I'm kind of disappointed with this product... I have a Sony cell, and I really had to work to shove it in this thing. Which is why I give it 3 stars... Reading the details about it when I bought it, it APPEARED to me that it would fit a variety of phones, so I bought it... I hope it holds up... But because it doesn't close all of the way around the phone, it leaves it vulnerable (in my opinion), for me to take it into the sauna after I'm done working out, so I can just relax and listen to my music... So that's a little disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Rummel

customer_reviews.title: Good for phone size, VELCRO IS CHEAP AND DOESN'T HOLD.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: After 3 uses, velcro stopped working. Velcro releases immediately and phone drops off of arm. It didn't tear, get wet or have anything stuck in velcro to prevent it from working. Sent back. DON'T RECOMMEND. The phone is exactly as described. Purchased for my Wife, whose bicep is a slender 9.5", via the tightest cinch. She likes it though, makes it work. Likes the color and the touch screen functions just fine. She doesn't need to take her Galaxy S8 out of it's semi-rigid holder in order for them both to fit in the armband. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great and as intended. Touch screen works fine through the case as well as Face ID if you have that. Holds phone securely and the band stays in place. Best arm band I have used. If you cant afford a fitness watch and have to lug your phone around or just like having your phone with you, then this is the arm band for you.
customer_reviews.author: ShadowAce

customer_reviews.title: Great running companion!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new one as my biceps grew a bit during the last year and a smaller one would no longer wrap around for use. This one is very comfortable and fits perfectly. It is very well made and even has a few discreet pouches for a key or other similar sized item. I love it, would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Geek Family

customer_reviews.title: I have short arms
customer_reviews.text: I'm short. I'm 5'4 and I have short arms. I ordered the large because of the phone I have and the holder just doesn't fit on my arm well. Granted, Houston is steamy in the summer and I ordered it for running, so I was super sweaty. It didn't mater which way I had the phone facing, somewhere the holder was chafing me. Maybe it would be good in a gym without a ton of sweat or walking or with a jacket. But this just didn't work for me in this scenario.
customer_reviews.author: C H

customer_reviews.title: Quality looks good
customer_reviews.text: Like the lightweight design and quality. Wish you improvise the design and size to fit forearm. We could access the phone better with that. (I know there are 360 rotate options available in some brands, but I am not a great fan of extra weight or protruding out of the arm. )
customer_reviews.author: sunny

customer_reviews.title: New Version Works For Running with iPhone XR
customer_reviews.text: Original comment: The band binds the arm and became annoying for me on 5-10k runs. It's somewhat tolerable if turned so the phone is facing toward the ground. I had to take the phone out of the case to fit properly. For walking, it would be okay, I guess, since it does hold the phone. UPDATE: The company reached out and offered/sent a upgraded version of the armband with a wider case that fits the arm snugly but doesn't pinch - AB100 Comrade Premium. This is good for my 5k. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas B. Tatro

customer_reviews.title: Armband not long enough
customer_reviews.text: So, the band was too small, and I have what I think are average-sized arms, so I was shocked when it arrived and the band was really short. Usually, these bands are long--almost too long, but this one was short and it barely wrapped all the way around my arm. I had to make sure it was tight enough, and it barely fit around my arm without cutting off circulation. So, I am returning it because it didn't work. I'm sorry, I wanted to like it, but it was just to short for my arm. Besides that, the screen worked great, it was really comfy material, but I couldn't get it to fit right.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Yoritomo

product_meta.title: TRIBE Water Resistant Cell Phone Armband Case for iPhone X, Xs, 8, 7, 6, 6S Samsung Galaxy S9, S8, S7, S6, A8 with Adjustable Elastic Band & Key Holder for Running, Walking, Hiking
feature_bullets: PHONE MODELS – The ideal phone holder for iPhone 8, 7, 6, 6s and other phone models similar in size and dimensions.

FULL TOUCHSCREEN FUNCTIONALITY – Our encased running armband acts as a workout phone holder while offering full protection and allowing easy access to your phone’s touchscreen functionality and headphone jack.

NO SLIP DESIGN – Unlike lower quality armbands, our premium running armbands are designed with the highest quality materials, including an extra-plush, adjustable elastic band to provide optimal comfort and fitment. Your phone is guaranteed to stay in place during the toughest workouts.

PREMIUM GRADE QUALITY MATERIALS – Made from premium Polyurethane and a mixture of Lycra and Neoprene to provide optimal comfort, extra protection for your phone as well as water resistant capabilities. The ultra-plush, adjustable elastic band is designed to flex, twist and bend during your toughest workouts without losing shape. We designed the toughest armband to stand up to your toughest workouts!

100% SATISFACTION LIFETIME GUARANTEE – All of our products come with a 100% satisfaction guaranteed. If you are not completely satisfied with your purchase, we will refund you fully or send you a replacement free of charge! No questions asked! We are 100% dedicated to providing you outstanding customer service, your questions or concerns will always be addressed timely and to your satisfaction! That is our commitment to every single customer.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars29,005 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
